questions.title: What is your address?
Does anyone live here as their permanent or family home?

content.title: Include
list: Yourself, if this is your permanent or family home
Family members including partners, children and babies born on or before 9 April 2017
Students and, or school children who live away from home during term time
Housemates tenants or lodgers

content.description: For most people, their permanent home will be the address where they spend the most time.

options.label: No
options.description: For example this is a second address or holiday home

questions.title: Can you confirm no one lives here as their permanent or family home?

content.title: This could be:
list: People who usually live outside the UK who are staying in the UK for three months or more
People who work away from home within the UK if this is their permanent or family home
Members of the Armed Forces if this is their permanent or family home
People who are temporarily outside the UK for less than 12 months
People staying temporarily who usually live in the UK but do not have another UK address, for example relatives, friends
Other people who usually live here, including anyone temporarily away from home

options.label: Someone lives here as their permanent home
options.value: Someone lives here as their permanent home

options.label: No one lives here as their permanent home
options.value: No one lives here as their permanent home

when.value: Someone lives here as their permanent home
No one lives here as their permanent home

questions.title: List the names of everyone  who lives here.

content.title: Include
list: Yourself, if this is your permanent or family home
Family members including partners, children and babies born on or before 9 April 2017
Students and, or school children who live away from home during term time
Housemates tenants or lodgers

messages.MANDATORY_TEXTFIELD: Please enter a name or remove the person to continue

content.description: Enter the current first, middle and last names of all the people who usually live here.
If you have not yet named your newborn, please enter ‘Baby’ for their first name and then enter their last name (surname).
Please also include household members who have requested a personal form.
Please also include the names of people staying with you temporarily who don’t have a usual address in the UK. This is so that we make sure we count everyone.

content.title: Include
list: People who usually live outside the UK who are staying in the UK for three months or more
People who work away from home within the UK  if this is their permanent or family home
Members of the Armed Forces if this is their permanent or family home
People who are temporarily outside the UK for less than 12 months
People staying temporarily who usually live in the UK but do not have another UK address, for example relatives, friends

questions.title: Is this everyone for whom this is their permanent or family home?
questions.description: Please note that you will need to ensure that everyone is included because you will be unable to make changes later

content.title: Include
list: People who usually live outside the UK who are staying in the UK for three months or more
People who work away from home within the UK  if this is their permanent or family home
Members of the Armed Forces if this is their permanent or family home
People who are temporarily outside the UK for less than 12 months
People staying temporarily who usually live in the UK but do not have another UK address, for example relatives, friends
Other people who usually live here, including anyone temporarily away from home

options.label: No, I need to add another person
options.value: No, I need to add another person

when.value: No, I need to add another person

questions.title: How many visitors are staying overnight here on 9th April 2017?

content.title: Include
list: People who usually live somewhere else in the UK. For example, boy or girl friends, relatives
People staying here because it is their second address, for example, for work. Their permanent or family home is elsewhere
People who usually live outside the UK who are visiting the UK for less than three months
People here on holiday

answers.label: Number of visitors (enter 0 if no visitors)

questions.title: How is {{ [answers.first_name[group_instance], answers.last_name[group_instance]] | format_household_name }} related to the people below?
questions.description: If members are not related, select the ‘unrelated’ option

list: Select the relationships between members of your household
If you are the parents of adopted children, select the ‘Mother or father’ option to show your relationship to them.
If you have foster children living with you, select the ‘Unrelated’ option.
Include half-brothers and half-sisters in the ‘Step-brother or step-sister’ category.
Same-sex civil partner is used to describe the relationship between two people who have legally registered a civil partnership.
If none of the options fully reflects your relationship, please select the one which you feel best describes your situation.

blocks.title: You have successfully completed the ‘Who lives here?’ section
blocks.description: In the next section we are going to ask you about the household and accommodation you live in.

questions.title: What type of accommodation is this?

options.label: Caravan or other mobile or temporary structure
options.value: Caravan or other mobile or temporary structure

questions.title: Is your house or bungalow:
Is your flat, maisonette or apartment:

options.label: In a purpose-built block of flats or tenement
options.value: In a purpose-built block of flats or tenement

options.label: Part of a converted or shared house (including bedsits)
options.value: Part of a converted or shared house (including bedsits)

options.label: In a commercial building (for example, in an office building, hotel, or over a  shop).
options.value: In a commercial building (for example, in an office building, hotel, or over a  shop).

questions.title: Is this household’s accommodation self-contained?

content.description: This means that all the rooms, including the kitchen, bathroom and toilet, are behind a door that only this household can use

options.label: Yes, all the rooms are behind a door that only this household can use
options.value: Yes, all the rooms are behind a door that only this household can use

questions.title: How many bedrooms are available for use only by this household?

content.description: Include all rooms built or converted for use as bedrooms, even if they’re not currently used as bedrooms

questions.title: What type of central heating does this accommodation have?
questions.description:
Central heating is a central system that generates heat for multiple rooms.

Select all that apply, whether or not you use it.

when.value: Someone lives here as their permanent home

questions.title: Does your household own or rent this accommodation?

content.description: ‘Owns outright’ means you own without a mortgage or loan, even if you pay a small amount of money to the lender for them to look after the deeds.
‘Part owns and part rents’ means you own part of your accommodation and also pay rent for part of it. You can part own with or without a mortgage or loan.
If your rent is paid by housing benefit, select ‘Rents (with or without housing benefit)’.
If you do not pay rent, but contribute to household expenses, you live rent free.

options.label: Owns with a mortgage or loan
options.value: Owns with a mortgage or loan

options.label: Part owns and part rents (shared ownership)
options.value: Part owns and part rents (shared ownership)

when.value: Owns with a mortgage or loan

questions.title: Who is your landlord?

options.label: Housing association, housing co-operative, charitable trust, registered social landlord
options.value: Housing association, housing co-operative, charitable trust, registered social landlord

options.label: Relative or friend of a household member
options.value: Relative or friend of a household member

questions.title: How many cars or vans are owned, or available for use, by members of this household?

content.description: Include any company cars or vans available for private use

questions.description: Anyone aged 16 or over who would like to keep their answers private can request a personal and confidential form.

content.description: If you request a personal or confidential form we will send you a unique access code that will allow you to complete the individual questions for yourself. No-one else will be able to see the answers you provide.

options.label: No, I do not want to request a personal form
options.value: No, I do not want to request a personal form

options.label: Yes, I want to request a personal form
options.value: Yes, I want to request a personal form

blocks.title: Request for personal and confidential form
blocks.description:
You can request a personal and confidential form online.

Alternatively, call 0300 068 3001.

questions.title: What is {{[answers.first_name[group_instance], answers.last_name[group_instance]] | format_household_name_possessive }} gender?
What is your date of birth?
On 9 April 2017, what is your legal marital or same-sex civil partnership status?

content.description: Please answer according to your status on 9 April 2017.
Please answer this question for children, even though they may not be old enough to marry or form a same-sex civil partnership.

If you were married (or formed a registered same-sex partnership) abroad, and this enables you to be recognised as married or civil partnered in the UK, complete the question reflecting that legal partnership.

options.label: Never married and never registered a same-sex civil partnership
options.value: Never married and never registered a same-sex civil partnership

options.label: In a registered same-sex civil partnership
options.value: In a registered same-sex civil partnership

options.label: Separated, but still legally in a same-sex civil partnership
options.value: Separated, but still legally in a same-sex civil partnership

options.label: Formerly in a same-sex civil partnership which is now legally dissolved
options.value: Formerly in a same-sex civil partnership which is now legally dissolved

options.label: Surviving partner from a same-sex civil partnership
options.value: Surviving partner from a same-sex civil partnership

questions.title: Do you stay at another address for more than 30 days a year?

content.description: Examples might include another parent’s address, an armed forces base, a holiday home, or term-time address.
The days you stay at the address do not have to be in a row. They can be at any time during the year.

options.label: Yes, an address within the UK
options.value: Yes, an address within the UK

options.label: Yes, an address outside the UK (please specify)

when.value: Yes, an address within the UK

questions.title: Enter details of the other UK address where you stay more than 30 days a year
What is that address?

options.label: Another address when working away from home
options.value: Another address when working away from home

questions.title: Are you a schoolchild or student in full-time education?

content.description: The following are considered to be in full-time education:
Under 16s
16-18s if they attend more than 12 hours a week of study on a course up to and including A level standard
Anyone on a course at a higher standard than A level if they are studying at a UK institution, on a course which:

list: lasts for at least 1 academic year
involves at least 24 weeks per year, and
involves at least 21 hours of term-time study, classes or work experience per week (including unstructured study)

questions.title: How would you describe your national identity?

content.description: You can choose more than one national identity.
It is for you to choose your national identity or identities. For example this could be about the country or countries where you feel you belong, or think of as home.
It is not dependent on your ethnic group or legal nationality (citizenship).
Select all that apply. If your national identity isn’t listed, select ‘Other’ and enter the national identity.

questions.title: How would you describe your national identity?

content.description: You can choose more than one national identity.
It is for you to choose your national identity or identities. For example this could be about the country or countries where you feel you belong, or think of as home.
It is not dependent on your ethnic group or legal nationality (citizenship).
Select all that apply. If your national identity isn’t listed, select ‘Other’ and enter the national identity.

questions.title: What is your ethnic group?

content.description: It is for you to choose your ethnic group. For example this could be your family or cultural background, or it could be how you would describe yourself.
Please select the answer you think is most appropriate.
If you don’t feel the options apply to you, select ‘Other ethnic group’. You will then be able to write in the ethnic group you prefer to identify as at the next question.

options.label: White
options.description: Including English / Welsh / Scottish / Northern Irish / British, Irish, Gypsy or Irish Traveller or any other White background

options.label: Mixed / multiple ethnic groups
options.description: Including White and Black Caribbean, White and Black African,  White and Asian or any other Mixed/multiple ethnic background

options.label: Asian / Asian British
options.description: Including Indian, Pakistani, Bangladeshi, Chinese or any other Asian background

options.label: Black / African / Caribbean / Black British
options.description: Including African, Caribbean or any other Black / African / Caribbean background

options.label: Other ethnic group
options.description: Including Arab or any other ethnic group

questions.title: Which of the following options best describes how you think of yourself?

content.description: It is for you to decide how to choose your answer.
If you are unsure of the meaning of any words used, the following might help:

list: ‘Heterosexual or Straight’ means that a person is, for example, attracted to people of the opposite sex/gender
‘Gay or Lesbian’ means that a person is, for example, attracted to people of the same sex/gender
‘Bisexual’ means that a person is, for example, attracted to people of both sexes/any gender

content.description: If none of the first three answer options apply to you, please select ‘Other’ and enter your preferred answer.
This question is voluntary; you can leave it blank if you prefer.

questions.title: Have you ever worked?

content.description: If you had a full-time or part-time job in the past select ‘Yes’
This includes work outside of the United Kingdom.
Please provide an answer even if you are retired.
If you have never worked, or only ever worked in voluntary/unpaid jobs, select ‘No’.

questions.title: In your main job, are (were) you:

content.description:
If you are not working answer the remaining questions about your last main job.

Your main job is the job which you usually work (worked) the most hours

questions.title: In your main job, how many hours a week do you usually work?

content.description: Include paid and unpaid overtime

questions.title: How do you usually travel to work?

content.description: Select the option for the longest part, in distance, of your journey
For example, you travel by bus and by car. Your bus journey is 5 miles, and the car journey is 8 miles. You should select car as your answer

options.label: Work mainly at or from home
options.value: Work mainly at or from home

options.label: Underground, metro, light rail or tram
options.value: Underground, metro, light rail or tram

questions.title: What is (was) your full and specific job title?

content.description:
For example, primary school teacher, car mechanic, district nurse, structural engineer

Do not state your grade or pay band
Please enter your job title in the space provided.
Do not state your grade or pay band.
If you are not sure of your job title please give the best information you can.

questions.title: Briefly describe what you do (did) in your main job.

content.description: Please enter a brief description of what you do or did in your main job. Your main job is the job in which you usually work (or worked) the most hours.
Please give the best information you can even if you’re not sure or can’t remember all the details.

questions.title: At your workplace what is (was) the main activity of your employer or business?

list: For example, primary education, repairing cars, contract catering, computer servicing
If you are (were) a civil servant, write government
If you are (were) a local government officer, write local government and give the name of the department within the local authority

content.description: Enter the main activity of your employer or business.
Another way of describing main activity is the industry that your employer or business works in.
If you are not sure of the main activity of your employer or business please give the best information you can.
If you are employed through an agency please enter the main activity of the business you are working for, not the agency.

questions.title: In your main job are (were) you:

options.value: Employed by an organisation or business

options.label: Self-employed in your own organisation or business
options.value: Self-employed in your own organisation or business

options.label: Not working for an organisation or business
options.value: Not working for an organisation or business

questions.title: In your main job, what is (was) the name of the organisation or business you work (worked) for?

content.description: If you were self-employed in your own organisation or business, enter the name
This question is asking for the name of the organisation or business that you work (or worked) for in your main job.
If you can’t remember the name of the organisation, please give the best information you can.
If you are employed through an agency please enter the name of the business you are working for, not the agency.

blocks.title: You have completed all questions for Visitor {{group_instance + 1}}
You have successfully completed the ‘Visitors’ section
You’re ready to submit your 2017 Census Test
blocks.description: Thank you for taking part in the 2017 Census Test.

content.title: Please note:
list: By submitting your responses, you are declaring that you have completed to the best of your knowledge and belief.
If you do not submit, your responses will be automatically submitted when the Census 2017 Test closes.
After submission you will have an opportunity to provide feedback on your experience.
